form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to delay the implementation of the penalty for failure to comply with the individual health insurance mandate.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Suspending the Individual Mandate Penalty Law Equals Fairness Act or as the SIMPLE Fairness Act.

section.header: Delay in implementation of penalty for failure to comply with individual health insurance mandate

subsection.text: Section 5000A(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection, the monthly penalty amount with respect to any taxpayer for any month beginning before January 1, 2015, shall be zero.

subsection.header: Delay of certain phase ins and indexing

paragraph.header: Phase in of percentage of income limitation
paragraph.text: Section 5000A(c)(2)(B) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2014 in clause (i) and inserting 2015, and
by striking 2015 in clauses (ii) and (iii) and inserting 2016.

paragraph.header: Phase in of applicable dollar amount
paragraph.text: Section 5000A(c)(3)(B) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2015 (before amendment by subparagraph (A)) and inserting 2016.

paragraph.text: Section 5000A(c)(3)(D) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2016 in the matter preceding clause (i) and inserting 2017, and
by striking 2015 in clause (ii) and inserting 2016.

paragraph.header: Indexing of exemption based on household income
paragraph.text: Section 5000A(e)(1)(D) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2014 (before amendment by subparagraph (B)) and inserting 2015, and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives March 5, 2014.
